fixes.fix_description: Revert earlier attempt; its on the wrong track.
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/opencog/query/PatternMatchEngine.cc
+++ b/opencog/query/PatternMatchEngine.cc
-/**
- * Explore a clause that is an AlwaysLink. Such clauses wrap evaluatable
- * predicates which must evaluate to true for every possible grounding
- * of the variables that they contain. Thus, an exhaustive search must
- * be made of those groundings, before continuing.
- */
-bool PatternMatchEngine::explore_clause_always(const PatternTermPtr& term,
-                                               const Handle& grnd,

--- a/lib/AtomSpaceConfig.cmake.in
+++ b/lib/AtomSpaceConfig.cmake.in
-# These names are used in various projects e.g. opencog, as-moses, etc.
-# XXX FIXME ... they probably should not be! It would be best if the all
-# of the libs were specified i.e. LINK_LIBRARIES(${ATOMSPACE_LIBRARIES})
-set(ATOMSPACE_LIBRARY atomspace)
-set(ATOMSPACE_atombase_LIBRARY atombase)
-set(ATOMSPACE_atomcore_LIBRARY atomcore)
-set(ATOMSPACE_atomflow_LIBRARY atomflow)
-set(ATOMSPACE_atomproto_LIBRARY value)

--- a/opencog/cython/opencog/type_constructors.pyx
+++ /dev/null
-#
-# This file reads files that are generated by the OPENCOG_ADD_ATOM_TYPES
-# macro so they can be imported using:
-#
-# from type_constructors import *
-#
-# This imports all the python wrappers for atom creation.
-#

fixes.fix_description: Do not generate atom types for the *_SIG mixin
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/cmake/OpenCogGenPythonTypes.cmake
+++ b/cmake/OpenCogGenPythonTypes.cmake
-	IF (NOT TYPE_NAME STREQUAL "Atom")
-		# XXX This is broken in two ways. First, createValue() is
-		# a C++ template, and so it can't be used like this.
-		# Also, PYTHON_SUPPORTED_VALUE_LIST is an empty list (above)
-		# so this is a no-op, anyway. XXX FIXME someday, I guess
-		# Until then, the value ctors are hard-coded into
-		# opencog/cython/opencog/type_constructors.pyx
-		IF (ISVALUE STREQUAL "VALUE" OR ISSTREAM STREQUAL "STREAM")

--- a/opencog/atoms/value/UnisetValue.cc
+++ b/opencog/atoms/value/UnisetValue.cc
-#if 1
-	// XXX FIXME ... I don't know if this is correct. It might be.
-	// At any rate, no unit test expects this.
-	//
-		if (0 == size())
+		if (0 == _value.size())
-#endif

fixes.fix_description: Do not generate atom types for the *_SIG mixin
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/cmake/OpenCogGenPythonTypes.cmake
+++ b/cmake/OpenCogGenPythonTypes.cmake
-	IF (NOT TYPE_NAME STREQUAL "Atom")
-		# XXX This is broken in two ways. First, createValue() is
-		# a C++ template, and so it can't be used like this.
-		# Also, PYTHON_SUPPORTED_VALUE_LIST is an empty list (above)
-		# so this is a no-op, anyway. XXX FIXME someday, I guess
-		# Until then, the value ctors are hard-coded into
-		# opencog/cython/opencog/type_constructors.pyx
-		IF (ISVALUE STREQUAL "VALUE" OR ISSTREAM STREQUAL "STREAM")

fixes.fix_description: Move cxxtest boilerplate out of the way
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt
-FIND_PACKAGE(Cxxtest)
-IF (NOT CXXTEST_FOUND)
-	MESSAGE(STATUS "CxxTest missing: needed for unit tests.")
-ENDIF (NOT CXXTEST_FOUND)
+# CxxTest setup (also provides OPENCOG_SETUP_TESTING macro)
+INCLUDE(OpenCogTestOptions)
-IF (CXXTEST_FOUND)
-	# Enable CTest support so that 'ctest' command works

fixes.fix_description: Avoid busy spinloops, use c++20 atomic::wait
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/opencog/util/async_buffer.h
+++ b/opencog/util/async_buffer.h
-#include <unistd.h> /* for usleep() */
- *
- * Another issue is that the assorted loops to drain queues use
- * spin-loops and usleeps. I think this is mostly harmless, but is
- * impure, and should be replaced by CV's. Doing so becomes much easier
- * once C++20 is widely available, as it has CV's on std::atomic ints.
-	// Spin a while, until the writer threads are (mostly) done.
+	// Wait until the writer threads are (mostly) done.

--- a/opencog/util/getopt_long.c
+++ /dev/null
-/*  $NetBSD: getopt_long.c,v 1.15 2002/01/31 22:43:40 tv Exp $  */
-/*  $FreeBSD: src/lib/libc/stdlib/getopt_long.c,v 1.2 2002/10/16 22:18:42 alfred Exp $ */
-/*-
- * Copyright (c) 2000 The NetBSD Foundation, Inc.
- * All rights reserved.
- *
- * This code is derived from software contributed to The NetBSD Foundation
- * by Dieter Baron and Thomas Klausner.

fixes.fix_description: Avoid busy spinloops, use c++20 atomic::wait
fixes.diff_snippet:
--- a/opencog/util/async_buffer.h
+++ b/opencog/util/async_buffer.h
-#include <unistd.h> /* for usleep() */
- *
- * Another issue is that the assorted loops to drain queues use
- * spin-loops and usleeps. I think this is mostly harmless, but is
- * impure, and should be replaced by CV's. Doing so becomes much easier
- * once C++20 is widely available, as it has CV's on std::atomic ints.
-	// Spin a while, until the writer threads are (mostly) done.
+	// Wait until the writer threads are (mostly) done.

--- a/CMakeLists.txt
+++ b/CMakeLists.txt
-# ----------------------------------------------------------
-# Needed for unit tests
-FIND_PACKAGE(Cxxtest)
-IF (NOT CXXTEST_FOUND)
-	MESSAGE(STATUS "CxxTest missing: needed for unit tests.")
-ENDIF (NOT CXXTEST_FOUND)
-IF (CXXTEST_FOUND)
-	ENABLE_TESTING()

-------------
-There will be a `CogServerNode`, derived from `ObjectNode`, accepting
-object messages. Each of the loadable modules should also be some form
+CogServerNode

+The `CogServerNode`, derived from `ObjectNode`, accepts object messages
